# ge walks

I call ge(n,sigma) the number of random walks, starting
at 0, that last 'n' steps without dropping below level 'sigma'.
This is a simple program to calculate those values.

I wrote this program years ago in Mathematica, and then in Haskell. Today,
I played with it in common lisp.

Example:

~~~~~~
CL-USER> (calc-ge 6000 0)
